intro: Hymenoxys cooperi, commonly known as the Cooper's hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellowish-white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Hymenoxys cooperi is also known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native climate.
